intro: Melandrium souliei, commonly known as the Chinese catchfly, is a herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, linear, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Melandrium souliei is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments.
